title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in South Sudan 2024
yAxis: GDP per capita in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2017 to 2014.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2024 to 2022.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2022 to 2020.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2020 to 2018.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2017.
gold: The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in South Sudan from 2014 to 2018 , with projections up until 2024 . GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year . It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth .
